moves.1. e4 d5 2. exd5: usually I capture hoping to gain a lead in development
moves.2... Qxd5: he chose to recoup the pawn right away and show intentions of an fast attack
moves.3... Qe5+ 4. Qe2: from all the options i chose the queen
moves.4... Qd6 5. d3 Nf6 6. Be3 c6 7. Nf3 Bg4: king to safety and focusing on his king side
moves.8... e6 9. Ne4: what will happen next is as predicted when i moved the knight
moves.10... Bxf3: take and attack my queen is good because his queen is protected by bishop so i will lose a rock for a bishop
moves.11... Qe5: he avoid my rock, but not a good move for future
moves.12. Kb1: more safety for the future plan ...
moves.12... Be7 13. Bd4:
now it begins, the sforce attack is unleashed ..
pining unprotected g7 pawn
moves.13... Qg5: protect the pawn and may have cause chess in case i did not moved my king preview
moves.14. h4 Qg6 15. h5 Qg5 16. h6: and away we go .... this not looks to good for black
moves.16... gxh6: he had other options than this, but none in his favor
moves.17. Bxh8: don't have to think twice for that ... mmm tasty
moves.17... Nd7: trying to castle on queen side
moves.18. Bd4: aiming for that a7 pawn in case of castle
moves.18... a6 19. Be3 Qa5: finally, after fighting for not losing an pawn (g7) it leaves behind 3 lost moves in wich black could have castle, a rock and a pawn (or two)
moves.23. Qxf7: qxf7 is definitely an option then a blunder Rhxf7 becouse of his knight Ne5
moves.24. Rxd7:
- I'm not aiming for you :)
I can not imagine an deadliest line on the opponent field
.... the end is near !!
moves.24... Bd6: from this point ... is a beginer's puzzle "find mate in two"
